intro: Cephalaria laevigata f. puberula, commonly known as the hairy cephalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its specific epithet "puberula." The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
